\noindent a is directly proportional to b. \
When a = 5, b = 20.\\

\[ a \propto b \quad \text{or} \quad a = k \cdot b \]
where k is the constant of proportionality.\\
Substitute the values a = 5 and b = 20 into the equation to find k:

\[ 5 = k \cdot 20 \quad \Rightarrow \quad k = \frac{5}{20} = \frac{1}{4} \]\\
Now, to find b when a = 7, use the formula:

\[ 7 = \frac{1}{4} \cdot b \quad \Rightarrow \quad b = 7 \times 4 = 28 \]\\
Thus, the value of b when a = 7 is \[ \boxed{28} \].

\noindent \textbf{(a) Mathematical Name of the Polygon} \
The polygon in question is a pentagon. This is because it has five sides.\

\vspace{0.5cm}\

\noindent \textbf{(b) Total Perimeter of the Prism} \
Each edge of the prism has a length of 7.5 cm. The prism has 10 edges: 5 edges on the front pentagon and 5 edges on the back pentagon (since the front and back pentagons are connected by edges).\

\vspace{0.5cm}\

To find the total perimeter, calculate the total length of all edges:\

\[\text{Total Perimeter} = 10 \times 7.5 \text{ cm} = 75 \text{ cm}\]\

Thus, the total perimeter of the prism is:\

\[\boxed{75 \text{ cm}}\]
